name: Sediment deposition patterns
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, spawning/benthic habitats, and supports riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: Deposition matches natural form, no severe bar formation beyond typical references.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Delineate bar types (point, mid-channel, lateral) and compare to expected morphology for the channel type.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Reach clogged with large deposits that force multi-threading where not natural.
Criteria: Widespread bar growth inconsistent with reference condition.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Multiple mid-channel bars that persist year to year and split flow.
Criteria: Pattern suggests imbalance in supply vs transport for expected channel type (Bridge 2003).

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Small lateral bars and occasional temporary islands.
Criteria: Minor departures from reference pattern.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Point bars present on bends. No persistent mid-channel bars.
Criteria: Bar types and locations match expected reference for a single-thread meandering channel (Leopold et al., 1964).
